text: Robert Eugene "Bob" Richards (February 20, 1926 - February 26, 2023), nicknamed the "Vaulting Vicar" or the "Pole Vaulting Parson" in his competitive days, was an American athlete who was known for pole vaulting in the Olympics. He competed in the 1948 (where he won a bronze medal), 1952 (gold medal), and 1956 Summer Olympics (gold medal) as a pole vaulter, and as a decathlete in 1956. In the 1984 United States presidential election, Richards ran for President of the United States on the far-right, white nationalist Populist Party ticket. Richards was born in Champaign, Illinois.Bob Richards . sports-reference.com He studied at the University of Illinois at Urbanaâ€“Champaign. title: Bob Richards
